senses: [{"definition":"That which is independent of context-dependent interpretation, inviolate, fundamental.","example":"moral absolutes"},{"definition":"Anything that is absolute.","example":null},{"definition":"In a plane, the two imaginary circular points at infinity; in space of three dimensions, the imaginary circle at infinity.","example":null},{"definition":"(usually capitalized) A realm which exists without reference to anything else; that which can be imagined purely by itself; absolute ego.","example":null},{"definition":"(usually capitalized) The unity of spirit and nature; God.","example":null},{"definition":"(usually capitalized) The whole of reality; the totality to which everything is reduced.","example":null},{"definition":"A concentrated natural flower oil, used for perfumes; an alcoholic extract of a concrete.","example":null},{"definition":"Free of restrictions, limitations, qualifications or conditions; unconditional.","example":"1658, Samuel Hoard, God[']s Love to Mankind, Manifested, by disprooving his absolute decree for their damnation"},{"definition":"Free from imperfection, perfect, complete; especially, perfectly embodying a quality in its essential characteristics or to its highest degree.","example":"absolute purity, absolute liberty"},{"definition":"Pure, free from mixture or adulteration; unmixed.","example":"absolute alcohol"},{"definition":"Complete, utter, outright; unmitigated, not qualified or diminished in any way.","example":"When caught, he told an absolute lie. \u00a0 an absolute denial of all charges"},{"definition":"Positive, certain; unquestionable.","example":null},{"definition":"Certain; free from doubt or uncertainty (e.g. a person, opinion or prediction).","example":null},{"definition":"Fundamental, ultimate, intrinsic; not relative; independent of references or relations to other things or standards.","example":"Absolute rights and duties are such as pertain to man in a state of nature as contradistinguished from relative rights and duties, or such as pertain to him in his social relations."},{"definition":"Independent of arbitrary units of measurement, standards, or properties; not comparative or relative.","example":"absolute velocity, absolute motion, absolute position"},{"definition":"(grammar) Not immediately dependent on the other parts of the sentence; not in a syntactical relation with other parts of a text, or qualifying the text as a whole rather than any single word in it, like \"it being over\" in \"it being over, she left\".","example":null},{"definition":"As measured using an absolute value.","example":"absolute deviation"},{"definition":"Indicating an expression that is true for all real numbers, or of all values of the variable; unconditional.","example":null},{"definition":"Pertaining to a grading system based on the knowledge of the individual and not on the comparative knowledge of the group of students.","example":null},{"definition":"Independent of (references to) other arts; expressing things (beauty, ideas, etc) only in one art.","example":"absolute music"},{"definition":"Absolved; free.","example":null}]
